comment.body: I think Zeronat and Ethereum can complete each other. Running an organisazation is dealing with rules. While it seems possible to decide regulations using zeronet, I don't see a way enforcing rules with zeronet. Providing such a possibility is the true inovation of ethereum.

> [namecoinfontas](#comment_1_1P8VJL2iKWfUB4hqQkrFdXCbC8RrimAZoZ): by definition zeronet itself and every page on it can already be considered a dao. since taking down the creators server has zero effect and they can run any scripts you can write aka smart contracts. all you need is to make a sites code audit-able im sure that isnt hard

Well, unfortunately I'm not a coder and so far I don't know very much about ethereum and Zeronet. So my judgement what's possible with one or the other is indeed weak. But I  think I's at least much easier to reward wanted and penalize unwanted behaviour Money is a very good instrument for regulating things. On the other side for providing content zeronet seems to be the better option. At least internet is big enough for both and much more.

> [namecoinfontas](#comment_2_1P8VJL2iKWfUB4hqQkrFdXCbC8RrimAZoZ): i dont think the internet is big enough for eth, i think eth is just a very, very well crafted ponzi scheme

We'll see
